document.masterDocTitle: Review of Chinese species of genus Scaphomonus Viraktamath, 2009 (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae), with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Chinese species of genus Scaphomonus Viraktamath, 2009 (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae), with description of a new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Scaphoideus indicus Distant, 1908 : 374
–375.

Scaphotettix indicus (Distant)
, n. comb. by Viraktamath & Mohan, 1993 : 464–466 ; Li & Wang 2005 : 193 .
Scaphomonus indicus (Distant)
, n. comb. by Dai et al. , 2009 : 661 ,
Fig. 6
A–H; Li et al ., 2011 : 261 .

Material examined. 23 2 Ƥ, China : Hainan Prov., Bawangling,
25 May 1983
, coll. Yalin Zhang; 73 5 Ƥ, Hainan Prov., Jiangfengling and Datian
13 July 2007
, coll. Yujian Li and Qiongzhang Song (GUGC).

Scaphotettix longistylus
Li & Wang, 2005 : 190 .

Scaphomonus longistylus
(Li & Wang), n. comb. by Dai et al. , 2009 : 661 ,
Fig. 7
A–H; Li et al ., 2011 : 262 .

Material examined. China : 13 ( Holotype ), Yunnan Prov., Mengla,
24 June 1994
, coll. Yuzhou Du (GUGC); 13 , Yunnan Prov., Xishuangbanna, Mengla,
24 July 2012
, coll. Weibin Zheng (GUGC). Distribution. China (Yunnan).

Note. The original name of this species refers to the very long subgenital plate, but mistakenly “
longistylus
” was written; in fact the style is not long.

Scaphoideus festivus Matsumura, Ishihara 1961 : 252
, misidentification, Thailand .
Scaphotettix splinterus
Li & Wang, 2005 : 189 .

Scaphomonus splinterus
(Li & Wang), n. comb. by Dai et al. , 2009 : 662 ,
Fig. 6
A–H; Li et al ., 2011 : 263 .

Material examined. China : 13 ( Holotype ), Guangdong Prov., Maoming City, Dianbai County,
12 June 1983
, coll. Yalin Zhang; 13 , Hubei Prov., Shennongjia,
11 August 1997
, coll. Maofa Yang; 13 , Yunnan Prov., Menghai,
24 July 2008
, coll. Jianda Li (GUGC).
Distribution. China (Guangdong, Hubei, Yunnan, Hainan); Thailand .

Scaphomonus widestyleus
Li, 2011
Figs 8–14
,
24– 25

Scaphomonus widestyleus
Li (in Li et al .), 2011 : 263–264 .

Material examined. China : 13 ( Holotype ), Fujian Prov., Mt. Wuyi, Guadun,
9 September 1978
, coll. Zhonglin Ge; 13 , Guangxi Autonomous Region, Shangsi County, Shiwandashan,
12 May 2009
, coll. Yanli Zheng (GUGC). Distribution. China (Fujian, Guangxi).
Note: The original figures of Li (in Li et al ., 2011 ) lack a view of the aedeagus in lateral view. Here, the first author has redrawn the male genitalia.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 8 –
14
Scaphomonus widestyleus
Li:
8, Male pygofer side, lateral view; 9, Valve, ventral view; 10,Subgenital plates, ventral view; 11, Aedeagus, ventral view; 12, Aedeagus, lateral view; 13, Connective, ventral view; 14, Style, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Scaphomonus furcatus
sp. nov.
Figs 15–21
,
26– 27

Description. Body ochraceous. Head with piceous submargial band on anterior margin, one transverse arcuate band between eyes anteriorly, narrowly margined with piceous, orange red (
Fig. 26
). Face with thin, arcuate, piceous submarginal band. Pronotum with anterior brown and posterior submarginal chocolate brown transverse bands (
Fig. 26
). Forewing ochraceous, with hyaline spots; piceous areas as shown in
Figs. 26–27
.
Measurement. Length (including tegmen): 3,4.9–5.0mm.

Type material.
Holotype 3 , China : Guangxi Autonomous Region, Jingxi County, Diding,
8 August 2010
, coll. Shanyi Zhou; Paratypes : 13 , Yunnan Prov., Xishuangbanna, Menglun,
28 July 2012
, coll. Weibin Zheng (GUGC).

Diagnosis. This species is similar to
Scaphomonus longistylus
(Li & Wang), but can be distinguished from the latter by the male pygofer with caudal process, aedeagal shaft forked at apex, and the apophysis of style very elongate.

Etymology. The species name is derived from the Latin words “
furcatus
”, referring to the apical fork of the aedeagus.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 15 –
21
Scaphomonus furcatus
sp. nov. :
15, Male pygofer side, lateral view; 16, Valve, ventral view; 17,Subgenital plates, ventral view; 18, Aedeagus, dorsal view; 19, Aedeagus, lateral view; 20, Connective, dorsal view; 21, Style, dorsal view.

FIGURES 22 –
27
Scaphomonus flataedeagus
Li:
22, 3, dorsal view; 23, 3, lateral view;
Scaphomonus widestyleus
Li:
24, 3, dorsal view; 25, 3, lateral view;
Scaphomonus furcatus
sp. nov. :
26, 3, dorsal view; 27, 3, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: We thank Professor ZHOU Shan-Yi, Guangxi Normal University, for his gift of the holotype . We thank Dr Chris Dietrich (Illinois Natural History Survey, Champaign, U.S.A. ) and an anonymous referee for reading the manuscript and making some suggestions. The project was supported by China Postdoctoral Science Foundation founded project ( 2012 M 521719 ) and the Natural Science Foundation of China ( 30270176 ).
